content.value_statement: Understanding context windows and attention mechanics is crucial for building effective AI agents. This skill teaches you how to optimize context usage, manage token budgets, and design efficient agent architectures.
actual_capabilities: Explains context components and their roles
Teaches attention mechanics and budget constraints
limitations: Educational content only - no active agent capabilities

prompt_templates.title: Context Architecture Review
prompt_templates.scenario: When designing a new agent system
prompt_templates.prompt: I'm designing an AI agent that needs to handle [describe task]. How should I structure the context to ensure optimal performance while staying within token limits?

prompt_templates.title: Debug Context Issues
prompt_templates.prompt: My AI agent is giving inconsistent responses. How can I diagnose if this is a context-related problem and what strategies should I use to fix it?

prompt_templates.title: Optimize Token Usage
prompt_templates.prompt: My agent is running into context window limits. What are the best practices for reducing token usage while maintaining performance?

prompt_templates.title: Progressive Disclosure Design
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to build an agent that can handle complex tasks requiring multiple tools and documents. How do I implement progressive disclosure to manage context efficiently?

output_examples.input: How do I structure context for a coding assistant that needs to understand project requirements, access documentation, and write code?
output: System Prompt: Define the assistant as a coding expert with clear constraints
Tool Definitions: Include file access, search, and code execution tools
Progressive Loading: Load project overview first, then specific docs as needed
Context Budget: Allocate ~20% to system/tools, 60% to active task, 20% reserve
Message Management: Summarize long conversations every 10-15 turns

best_practices: Treat context as a finite resource with diminishing returns
Place critical information at attention-favored positions (beginning and end)
Use progressive disclosure to defer loading until needed
Monitor context usage during development with 70-80% compaction triggers
anti_patterns: Pre-loading all possible information instead of just-in-time loading
Ignoring context degradation hoping larger windows will solve memory issues
Using vague high-level guidance that fails to give concrete behavioral signals
Hardcoding complex brittle logic that creates maintenance burden

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with all AI platforms?
faq.answer: The concepts apply broadly but examples focus on Claude/Anthropic. Principles are universal for transformer-based models.

faq.question: What are the context limits I should design for?
faq.answer: Design for 70-80% of stated limits. Claude 3 models have 200K tokens but effective performance degrades beyond 150K.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my existing agent framework?
faq.answer: Yes. The patterns are framework-agnostic. Adapt the ContextBuilder class to your specific needs.

faq.question: How does this handle sensitive data in context?
faq.answer: The skill focuses on structure, not content. Implement your own data handling policies for sensitive information.

faq.question: My agent still hits limits after optimization. What's next?
faq.answer: Consider context-compression skill for advanced techniques like summarization and selective retention.

faq.question: How does this compare to other context management approaches?
faq.answer: This skill emphasizes foundational understanding. Other skills in the collection build on these basics for specific use cases.
